duties: Supporting, advising and challenging Operations management to ensure that their risks are understood and well controlled. The role includes analysing the performance of the control environment, performing end to end reviews, deep dive thematic reviews to identify weaknesses and designing new or modified controls to remediate these weaknesses.

Supporting the Operations CCO lead and the team to deliver the required support to Operations management. Shoulder additional responsibilities beyond the region and support the team into becoming a much stronger team by sharing best practices, mentoring and coaching new staff etc.

In addition to this, the role will support the evolution of the capability and toolset of the Chief Control Office (e.g. develop more insightful forward-looking measures) and support the transformation of CCO Operations through active engagement with Transformation team on automation projects and implementing cost effective controls to mitigate risk etc.

Intellectually curious and inquisitive

Able to develop creative solutions to difficult problems
Able to pro-actively identify and resolve issues with minimal supervision
Strong relationship management, collaboration and influencing skills with experience of positive, challenging interactions with senior management.
Strong written and verbal communication skills: ability to present complex issues simply and concisely,
Able to build productive working relationships with colleagues from different cultures and backgrounds and operate effectively within a globally dispersed team operating in different time zones.
Able to drive and successfully deliver multiple, wide-ranging priorities, often under stringent time pressures in a dynamic environment
Able to influence others; able to build and led build transient informal teams to solve specific issues
Knowledge of retail banking, commercial banking and investment banking products and services
Understanding of risk and control frameworks and risk polices
Knowledge of best practice in risk management

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

In addition to the Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Council, Zoetis has six colleague resource groups that bring together colleagues who share similar backgrounds, experiences, or interests and work together toward goals aligned with our strategic business priorities.
Our commitment to advancing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion has earned us recognitions as a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality, a 100 Best Company for Working Mothers, a Top Company for Executive Women, among many others.

PerkinElmer enables scientists, researchers and clinicians to address their most critical challenges across science and healthcare. With a mission focused on innovating for a healthier world, we deliver unique solutions to serve the diagnostics, life sciences, food and applied markets. We strategically partner with customers to enable earlier and more accurate insights supported by deep market knowledge and technical expertise. Our dedicated team of 12,500 employees worldwide is passionate about helping customers work to create healthier families, improve the quality of life, and sustain the wellbeing and longevity of people globally. The Company reported revenue of approximately $2.8 billion in 2018, serves customers in more than 150 countries, and is a component of the S&P 500 index.

Works with management to address all aspects of commodity management, including procurement support, commodity business plans, market trends assessment, pricing, and product availability.
Requires domestic or global expertise of assigned commodities.

Meet Packhelp. We are experts in the unboxing experience. We are an international group of 250 professionals who helped more than 50 000 companies from all over Europe bring joy with each package they've sent to their customers.
On the outside, we look like a packaging producer. But take a closer look and you will see one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe. We create a revolutionary technology that unleashes creativity, speeds up packaging development, and automates mundane tasks. We help our customers to redirect their attention to the things that matter the most to their business! As we take care of their packaging.
But we don't want to stop here. We are on a mission. We want to offer brands an unparalleled unboxing experience, but not at the expense of our planet. We made it our number one priority to help brands transition to sustainable solutions.
As one of the fastest-growing tech startups in Europe, we constantly expand and need more and more amazing specialists who will join our ranks. This is where you come in. Project Manager - Ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups, or activities, making effective judgments as to prioritizing and time allocation.
Critical Thinking - Ability to formulate conclusions and recommendations using facts and data, financial and business analysis, deductive reasoning, and sound judgment.
Consulting - Ability to effectively provide technical or business guidance to clients, both internal and external; knowledge of applicable tools and techniques to maximize consulting effectiveness.

Relationship Management - Ability to develop and maintain effective and productive relationships, including the ability to influence, negotiate and manage conflicts effectively and constructively with clients, vendors, and peers.
Knowledge of the Business - Knowledge of the business and the key internal and external drivers that affect the business, including financial, political, and industry trends.

Groupon is an experiences marketplace that brings people more ways to get the most out of their city or wherever they may be. By enabling real-time mobile commerce across local businesses, live events and travel destinations, Groupon helps people find and discover experiencesâ€“â€“big and small, new and familiarâ€“â€“that make for a full, fun and rewarding life. Groupon helps local businesses grow and strengthen customer relationshipsâ€“â€“resulting in strong, vibrant communities. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success.
We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a great way to grow your career?

What do we believe in?

Triggering innovation by collaboration â€“ this is our mission. Consultancy is people business and knowledge is key. That is why we value our employees as much as our clients. About Us
From Strategy to Results.
CAMELOT is the globally leading consulting specialist for value chain management in the process, consumer product goods and manufacturing industries. As a specialist we stand for leading-edge expertise, innovative concepts, and solutions as well as for superior project quality and results.
CAMELOT has founded a new office in Wroclaw Poland, which will function as a supply chain innovation and technology center for the CAMELOT Group. You will be part of a growing team at the globally leading value chain specialist, applying best tools and approaches and your passion for consulting to help our clients build winning supply chain strategies for the New Now. We can offer you interesting projects with leading clients around the globe, always new and varying challenges, high-quality training & development to further build your skills, and attractive development opportunities within CAMELOT group in Poland or globally.

About Us
From Innovations to Solutions.
Camelot is the leading SAP consultancy for digital value chain management. With more than 25 years of experience we lead our customers in their digital transformation. Our capabilities range from the strategic dialogue around current challenges in the digital world to the implementation and support of innovative solutions.
Camelot is providing SaaS Solutions to its customers in the field of Supply Chain Management and to complement consulting services that we offer. Our applications share a common platform, which implements administrative capabilities. Learn more about our solutions here: https://www.camelot-itlab.com/avatar
Camelot has founded a new office in Wroclaw Poland, which will function as a supply chain innovation and technology center for the Camelot Group. You will be part of a growing team at the globally leading value chain specialist, applying a cutting-edge technology stack to build the supply chain solutions of the future. We can offer you interesting projects with leading clients around the globe, always new and varying challenges, high-quality training & development to further build your skills, and attractive development opportunities within Camelot group in Poland or globally.

duties: Developing and implementing Purchasing sourcing plans, actions and sourcing strategies in line with agreed European wide Procurement strategies and plans.
Conducting and supporting supplier audits.
Managing of all expenses to third parties in the most cost efficient way and optimizing the purchase of direct production materials.
Leading the local plant supplier price negotiations in line with agreed budget/policies.
Managing budget and spend categories including capex, high value indirect spend.
Ensuring that supplier performance is maintained and any corrective actions are put in place where any deviations occur.
Ensuring compliance with the requirements of IATF 16 949, ISO 14001, ISO 50001, safety and environment, specific requirements of OE customers, corporate and local procedures.
Providing leadership to the Plant Purchasing team of 3 employees, setting their priorities, ensuring their objectives are linked to the Plant Purchasing and European Purchasing.
Working closely with the commodity managers and cross functional teams on cost reduction initiatives/more efficient purchasing strategy.
requirements: Degree level within a Purchasing related subject field, Economics or Technical.
Minimum of 5 years relevant work experience within a Plant Purchasing or Central Purchasing role. Ideally from a manufacturing or automotive background in a European / Multinational organization.
Proven experience of working within a number of functions outside of Purchasing. Ability to take a critical look at the whole organization, function and processes.
Working experience in an environment where price/cost reduction is high priority.
Experience of leading cost reduction programs and tracking, reporting out savings.
Demonstrated ability to lead complex negotiations to create a win outcome for the company/supplier.
Demonstrated understanding and process based use of problem solving techniques. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
Very good English in speaking and writing (min. B2)
offered: The opportunity to gain valuable experience within a large international corporation.

Exide Technologies S.A
Exide Technologies, headquartered near Paris, France, is a leading provider of advanced energy storage solutions for the automotive and industrial markets. It designs, manufactures and markets todayâ€™s and next-generation battery technologies used across a wide range of applications, from automotive and off-road to material handling, stationary, rail and defense. Exide Technologies serves the global markets with top-notch battery technologies, know-how & added-value services under many well-known brands.
As an original equipment manufacturer to leading automotive and industrial equipment manufacturers, Exide Technologies has been involved in many of the significant breakthrough energy-storage developments that are enabling innovation across the markets. With two R&D facilities, nine production plants and three recycling plants in Europe, Exide is committed to high quality engineering, manufacturing and recycling, and continues to power the world with the most efficient energy solutions and helping customers maximize productivity and performance. Exide Technologies is serving the markets with products and services of an annual value of ~1,5bn Euro.

duties: Create something new: You will work in one of our most exciting IT areas â€“ the Bosch Hybrid Cloud â€“, which enables the Bosch business units to deploy their innovative business models in mobility, industry, smart home and other areas

Reliable implementation: In the role of the Cloud Architect / Development Engineer, you support the product team in the design, implementation, and further development of the OpenShift platform and automation code
Integrated implementation: You are responsible for the design & integration of cloud services to the platform and concept new platform features

Help shape the future: You are interested in and informed about new cloud technologies and design the further development of our products, organization, and implementation of the Bosch Hybrid Cloud Strategy
Take responsibility: You are part of our product team and therefore responsible for the fulfillment of the business demands and a close customer communication
Experience cooperation: You will be part of our worldwide Bosch Hybrid Cloud Cloud Team which consists currently of multiple product teams in Europe, Asia and Americas
requirements: Personality: IT-guy, reliable, team player, innovative and motivated

Working Practice: solution-oriented, analytical and entrepreneurial thinking. Organized and structured, responsible and comfortable in an agile working environment (SCRUM). Ability to explain complex scenarios

Experience: In-depth professional experience in cloud architectures and ideally knowledge in one or more IT infrastructure areas (Compute, Network, Storage), container technologies or experience with Public Cloud Stacks like AWS or Azure

Knowledge: Advanced architectural cloud competencies (Red Hat Certified Architect, AWS/Azure certified Cloud architect, TOGAF or similar). Very good Linux skills especially in RHEL and CentOS, knowledge of one or more programming languages (e.g., Java or C#), scripting (e.g., Bash or Python), CI/CD (e.g., Git, Jenkins, Concourse, Artifactory) and knowledge of cloud technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes
Enthusiasm: Interest in current IT cloud technologies and Platform as a service
Education: completed degree with a focus in information technology (Computer Science etc.) or similar qualification
Languages: Very good English skills both written and spoken, preferably German skills
offered: Contract of employment and a competitive salary (together with annual bonus)
Flexible working hours with home office after the pandemic as well
Complex environment of working, professional support and possibility to share knowledge and best practices
On-going development opportunities in a multinational environment
Broad access to professional trainings, conferences and webinars
Private medical care and life insurance
Sport pass, co-financing lunches, language courses
Number of benefits for families (for instance summer camps for kids)
Referral Bonus Program
Non working days on the 24th and 31st of December

CARDIOMATICS Sp. z o.o.
Cardiomatics is a digital health company developing software for automated ECG (electrocardiogram) interpretation. Software consists of web-application and algorithms leveraging state-of-the art technologies as deep neural networks. Our mission is to bring advanced cardiac diagnostics closer to patients by employing cloud and machine learning.
Cardiomatics team consists of 30+ people: software developers, data scientists, quality assurance, analysts, business development managers, marketing and customer success.
Our users are physicians. But not only cardiologists. According to our mission we deploy Cardiomatics also in primary care. Our software fits nicely with either small practices (single physician) as hospitals or even networks of hospitals.

LSEG (London Stock Exchange Group)
LSEG
LSEG (London Stock Exchange Group) is more than a diversified global financial markets infrastructure and data business. We are dedicated, open-access partners with a commitment to excellence in delivering the services our customers expect from us. With extensive experience, deep knowledge and worldwide presence across financial markets, we enable businesses and economies around the world to fund innovation, manage risk and create jobs. Data & Analytics

And our high-performance solutions â€“from trading, to market surveillance, to wealth solutions and moreâ€“help to enhance the performance of our customers.

The combination of Refinitiv and FTSE Russell provides LSEG with leading capabilities in data, analytics, indices and benchmarks
Capital Markets
We offer our customers extensive access to capital markets and liquidity across multiple asset classes. We operate a broad range of international equity, fixed income, exchange-traded funds/exchange-traded products and foreign exchange markets. Our Group is home to several capital formation and execution venues: London Stock Exchange, AIM, Turquoise, CurveGlobal, FXall and Tradeweb (through a majority ownership interest).
Post Trade
We support our customersâ€™ clearing and reporting obligations, providing risk, balance sheet and financial resource management solutions, whilst working with our other divisions to extend this support across the value chain.
A leading global clearing house with a strong presence across multiple asset classes, LCH helps financial institutions all over the world use their capital efficiently and manage counterparty risk. We work closely with sell-side clearing members and buy-side clients in conjunction with trading venues globally. UnaVista, a regulated platform that helps customers meet their reporting compliance obligations and reduce operational and regulatory risk through reporting, reference data and analytics solutions, further complements our Post Trade offering.
Through a comprehensive suite of trusted financial market infrastructure services â€“and our open-access model â€“we provide the flexibility, stability and trust that enable our customers to pursue their ambitions with confidence and clarity.
LSEG is headquartered in the United Kingdom, with significant operations in 70 countries across EMEA, North America, Latin America and Asia Pacific. We employ 25,000 people globally, more than half located in Asia Pacific.

LSEG (London Stock Exchange Group)
LSEG
LSEG (London Stock Exchange Group) is more than a diversified global financial markets infrastructure and data business. We are dedicated, open-access partners with a commitment to excellence in delivering the services our customers expect from us. With extensive experience, deep knowledge and worldwide presence across financial markets, we enable businesses and economies around the world to fund innovation, manage risk and create jobs. Itâ€™s how weâ€™ve contributed to supporting the financial stability and growth of communities and economies globally for more than 300 years.
Data & Analytics
Our acquisition of Refinitiv means we can provide the breadth and depth of financial data and best-in-class analytics that customers expect â€“driving innovation and growth across global markets. And our high-performance solutions â€“from trading, to market surveillance, to wealth solutions and moreâ€“help to enhance the performance of our customers.
FTSE Russell is a leading global provider of financial indexing, benchmarking and analytic services with more than $16 trillion benchmarked to our indices â€“and offers an extensive range of data services and research.
The combination of Refinitiv and FTSE Russell provides LSEG with leading capabilities in data, analytics, indices and benchmarks
Capital Markets
We offer our customers extensive access to capital markets and liquidity across multiple asset classes. We operate a broad range of international equity, fixed income, exchange-traded funds/exchange-traded products and foreign exchange markets. Our Group is home to several capital formation and execution venues: London Stock Exchange, AIM, Turquoise, CurveGlobal, FXall and Tradeweb (through a majority ownership interest).
Post Trade
We support our customersâ€™ clearing and reporting obligations, providing risk, balance sheet and financial resource management solutions, whilst working with our other divisions to extend this support across the value chain.
A leading global clearing house with a strong presence across multiple asset classes, LCH helps financial institutions all over the world use their capital efficiently and manage counterparty risk. We work closely with sell-side clearing members and buy-side clients in conjunction with trading venues globally. UnaVista, a regulated platform that helps customers meet their reporting compliance obligations and reduce operational and regulatory risk through reporting, reference data and analytics solutions, further complements our Post Trade offering.
Through a comprehensive suite of trusted financial market infrastructure services â€“and our open-access model â€“we provide the flexibility, stability and trust that enable our customers to pursue their ambitions with confidence and clarity.
LSEG is headquartered in the United Kingdom, with significant operations in 70 countries across EMEA, North America, Latin America and Asia Pacific. We employ 25,000 people globally, more than half located in Asia Pacific.
